repnme.cdata!:
Philippines - EC-TF for Health Sector
            Reform Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the EC-TF for Health Sector
            Reform Project for Philippines were as follows: outcomes
            were moderately unsatisfactory: risk to global environment
            outcome was moderate; bank performance was moderately
            unsatisfactory; and borrower performance was moderately
            satisfactory. Some lessons learned includes: (i) use of
            country systems in national program support operations to
            ensure ownership and continuity of reforms; (ii)
            strengthening results and policy focus of national program
            support; (iii) increased capacity building to ensure that
            decentralized services respond to supply and demand; (iv)
            strengthening  Monitoring And Evaluation (M&E)
            focus;(v) the need for monitoring and sharing of information
            to make a useful contribution to mainstreaming  improvements
            of healthcare delivery; (vi) strengthening central-local
            relations, particularly in promoting the introduction of
            national programs ; and  (vii) in the process of devolution
            for a country like the Philippines, third party verification
            should also comprise performance and management audits to
            better inform and resolve issues of implementation.

repnme.cdata!:
Philippines - Health Sector Reform Project
            : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Health Sector
            Reform Project for Philippines is to increase utilization of
            affordable and financially sustainable, good quality
            essential health services by the poor in participating
            localities through the progressive implementation of the
            Philippine Government's Health Sector Reform Agenda
            (HSRA). The extension is necessary to enable the Department
            of Health (DOH) to fully implement its planned activities,
            to finish the procurement process for Autonomous Region in
            Muslim Mindanao (ARMM) and to help Local Government Units
            (LGUs) utilize the community-based grants. The DOH has an
            action plan covering the above activities. The closing date
            is proposed to be extended by four months from June 30, 2012
            to October 31, 2012.

display_title.display_title:
Philippines - Health Sector
            Reform Project : restructuring : Main report

            REFORM PROJECT - SUPERVISION,TF090182-PHILIPPINES HEALTH SECTOR
            REFORM PROJECT

repnme.cdata!:
Philippines - Multi-Donor Trust Fund for
            Health Sector Reform Project : indigenous peoples policy framework

abstracts.cdata!:
The Multi-Donor Trust Fund for Health
            Sector Reform Project for Philippines will support the
            implementation of the government's health sector reform
            known as formula one for health, the first phase of which
            will be implemented in some convergence provinces where
            several group of Indigenous Peoples (IPs) reside. Negative
            measures include: the indigenous groups health practices are
            still very much influenced by their traditions and cultural
            values. The problems encountered in the implementation of
            health programs for the IPs are mostly due to the geographic
            isolation and inaccessibility of their location from health
            facilities and health providers. Mitigation measures
            include: a) improved financial protection of poor households
            health care costs through extended insurance coverage in
            project provinces; b) improved operational efficiency and
            service provision in public hospitals in project provinces;
            c) increased utilization of cost-effective public health
            programs and primary health care services in project
            provinces; and d) improved health sector planning,
            monitoring and evaluation at local and national level.
